chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald N. Kester was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault), a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Defendant to undergo a Psychological Evaluation and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with any children under the age of 18 years, except for the defendants two sons. The only contact that will be permitted will be with the express written approval of the supervising agent. The denendant is to have NO CONCTACT with the victim as named inthe complaint. The defendant is to have no contact with J. Kester unless as part of a Family Court Order.

Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.  Defendant to comply with the Sex Offender Registration Program-Life Registry.  Complete a Sex Offender Treatment Assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the Supervising Agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 9:08 am case called. Defendant Donald N. Kester in court with attorney Genelle M. Johnson.  Defendant Donald N. Kester in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over matter pending today. PSI has been received by all parties. Attorney Johnson has reviewed with defendant-no material errors or corrections needed. Attorney Blader has reviewed the PSI and finds no material errors or corrections needed. Court makes statement regarding submission by defendant prior to going on the record. Victim rights addressed-written statement by victims mother-read by DA Blader into the record. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Johnson. No statement by defendant. Allocution by Court. Court sentences the defendant to: 40 years Wisconsin State Prison to be served as 25 years Initial Confinement and 15 years Extended Supervision. Credit for 395 days served. CONDITIONS of Extended Supervision: The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with any children under the age of 18 years except for the defendants two sons. The only contact that will be permitted will be with express written approval by the supervising agent. No Contact whatsoever with the victim as named in the complaint. No Contact what so ever with J. Kester unless as part of a Family Court Order. Sex Offender Treatment and follow through, Sex Offender Registration for Life. Psychological Examination and follow through. Costs to be paid through 25 % of inmate earnings. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Court finds defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program. Appeal Rights Given.
Sentencing hearing at 03-01-2016 09:00 am

9:03 am case called. Defendant Donald N. Kester in court with attorney Genelle M. Johnson.  Defendant Donald N. Kester in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court makes statement regarding status-received a plea questionnaire. Statement by DA Blader regarding resolution. Attorney Johnson concurs with recitation of agreeement. Court questions defendant regarding resolution and defendant concurs.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Court orders a PSI to be completed. Bond revoked and defendant remanded to Waushara County Jail.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Case called @ 1:53 p.m. Defendant Donald N. Kester in court with attorney Genelle M. Johnson.  Defendant Donald N. Kester in custody.  Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Johnson - DE is not prepared to enter a plea at this time and is requesting a jury trial. DA Blader feels that three days will be necessary for trial. The court notes that the bifurcated plea will remain the plea entered. Primary trial dates December 2, 3 & 4. Secondary trial dates January 20, 21, 22. DA Blader will check with the doctor's to verify their availability for trial. FPT to be scheduled after the JT dates are set approximately one month prior to trial. DA Blader must notify the court by the close of business on 10/12/2015 as to the date that jury trial will work for the doctors. The court orders Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions and Proposed Verdict forms to be filed no later than one week prior to the final pre-trial. 14 jurors to be impaneled, 24 in the box, 5 strikes per side for a total of 10 strikes, 40 jurors to be summoned.
Plea hearing at 10-09-2015 01:45 pm

Not to possess any dangerous weapons including any firearms.  Not to leave the state of Wisconsin.  No contact with any children under the age of 18 years unless in the immediate company of a parent or legal guardian.

Case Called @ 1:08 PM:  Defendant Donald N. Kester in court with attorney Genelle M. Johnson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Def BOT.  INFO Filed.  ARGN to proceed today.  INFO Stated - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.   NGP received and entered.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Atty Johnson requests Court amend bond conditions pursuant to Def's motion filed as to no contact provisions with Def's wife and possible cash reduction.  Argument by DA Blader as to any amendment of bond.  Victim present in Court and makes statement as to bond amendment.  The Court will permit communication in writing as to issues solely relating to the current marital situation.  Court declines modification of the cash bond amount due to minimum mandatory attached.  It is appropriate to order as per victim's wishes to amend bond conditions - to relate solely as to issues concerning child in common and dissolution of the marriage and division of property.  Not to be used as a mechanism to rekindle relationship with his wife in any fashion.  Only communication authorized with victim right now is to be soley in writing.  Status conference scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
Bail/Bond Review on February 24, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Amend No Contact Provisions of the Cash Bond Ordered
Initial appearance on February 24, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Not to possess any dangerous weapons including any firearms.  Not to leave the State of Wisconsin.  No contact with any children under the age of 18 years unless in the immediate company of a parent or legal guardian.

Case Called @ 1:12 pm: Defendant Donald N. Kester in court, in custody, with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  DA argues as to significant cash bond w/conditions.  SPD argues as to significant lower cash bond.  Court orders cash bond in the amount of $10,000.00 w/conditions.    IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
